Why was the young Nancy so fair!</br>Ah!  tell me, ye Shepherds, I pray?</br>I saw her — and I must despair—</br>She's richer, far richer, than me.
Poor Damon was ever content,</br>Till Nancy appear'd on our Plain;</br>Such Beauty by Heaven was sent—</br>But why should it wound a poor Swain?
My Lambkins were once my Delight,</br>I thought myself rich as a King;</br>No more does their Bleating invite,</br>To the Tabor no more I can sing.
Nor my Dog I regard as before,</br>But frown as he kisses my Feet:</br>I haste to the Eglantine Bower,</br>And sigh as I feel my Heart beat.
Ah!  if I had Riches in Store,</br>My Tongue shou'd my Passion declare;</br>But wishing will never add more,</br>So Damon must sigh and despair.
And Nancy she never shall hear</br>The Passion which troubles my Breast;</br>In Secret shall trickle my Tear,</br>But Nancy I hope will be blest.</br>
